summary: The Carpenters were an American musical duo made up of siblings Karen and Richard Carpenter. They were known for their soft, harmonious music, featuring Karen's unique contralto voice. Born in Connecticut, they moved to California and started performing together in 1965. They achieved fame in the 1970s with hits like "(They Long to Be) Close to You" and "We've Only Just Begun". The Carpenters faced personal struggles, including Karen's battle with anorexia nervosa, which ultimately led to her death in 1983. Despite this tragedy, their music remains popular, with over 100 million records sold worldwide.
title: The Carpenters
